values:
Some bitch called the Humane Society to tell them that my friend Nick was mistreating his dog, Carter.  They said he was too small and very skinny.

Umm.  He's a Boston Terrier, of course he's going to be small.  He was also the runt of the litter, and he's three years old.

My friend Alexx who works at the Humane Society recognized the address of the report, and told her manager that it was bullshit.

Nick loves Carter, he's owned him since he was six weeks old.  If anything happened to Carter (like him being taken away), Nick would be absolutely devestated.

I told him about it tonight, and he demanded that I give him Alexx's number to get more information for him.  Apparently they sent someone to his house the other day, but no one was home.

He's pretty certain on who the person is, and he's super pissed.  =(  I don't want Carter to be taken away, I love that dog almost as much as Nick.  He's my second favorite dog next to my puppy Liza.  I hope this thing blows over soon.

I ate Taco Hell last night, and not even two minutes after eating it my stomach started screaming at me.  It was screaming, "Why the fuck did you eat that?!?!"

Stupid stomach.  I'm blessed with a stomach that can't handle certain kinds of food, but can hold a lot of liquor.


Go me.

I leave to go to Vegas tomorrow!!!

I'm flying out of Cedar Rapids, IA in the afternoon and coming back Tuesday evening.

Wooooooooooooooooooo!

The idea that a guy could come between two best friends, two of my best friends, and quite possibly ruin everything is sickening.  Granted, he is very cute and a very nice guy and it's not his intention to turn them against one another.  He is also a good friend of mine.

Friend one has had a crush on him for months but never made advances.  Friend two met him through friend one but kept her distance up until recently.

To make matters worse, my two friends live with each other.  Friend one was helping her parents move out of their house last night, so she wasn't home.  Friend two had some of us over, including this boy.  They ended up sleeping in her bed... though I doubt they did "anything".  She likes him and he likes her.

Friend one doesn't know that he spent the night, but knows that friend two and the guy like each other.  She is understandably upset, but at the same time she's being rather selfish.  She's considering getting back together with her ex-boyfriend who treated her like dirt (at least for the last few months they were dating) but promises that things would be different.  She has also being hanging out with a guy who she works with, but is significantly older than her (about 18 years).  Then she also claims that she doesn't want to date anyone right now.

I talked to friend two today and she was upset that friend one was mad at her.  She asked me for advice, and I wish that people would realize that I suck at giving advice.  I'm a listener, and that's about it.  Usually when people tell me their problems, they wind up working it out themselves (which is how I function).

I've been in this situation before.  I had a crush on this guy for a really long time, and then out of no where he starts dating this one girl.  Now she's a very good friend of mine, and doesn't know that I had a thing for her boyfriend - they're so blissfully happy now, it's insane.  I was upset, but I moved on when I saw how happy they made each other.

Time after time, I've play the neutral party when two of my friends were fighting.  It's what I want to do now, but I'm leaning towards friend two.  Friend one has had her chances and if he doesn't like her in that way, then she should just realize it.  I would hope that she's mature enough to see that those two are happy together, although I don't want to tell her this.



I want to stay away, but I know I can't.
It's beautiful outside.  I want to call some friends and play in nature.

Apparently, I was talking shit about this girl who used to date this guy Ryan I was seeing for awhile.  Supposedly, I was giving her dirty looks and threatening her.  I honestly don't recall any of this, but we smoothed things over.

Ryan is a douche.  He and I were supposed to hang out on Tuesday because he left for Vegas on Wednesday.  He's supposed to call me when he gets a new phone out there (he moved to become a stock broker with his brother) for when I go out there in two weeks.

March 23-27 I will be in Las Vegas!  Woo!!

I work in a crappy restaurant that is going downhill fast.  The restaurant itself isn't shitty, rather nobody likes to clean up their own messes or do any actual work.  They just opened in December and they already have a terrible rep around town (and in a town of 60,000, that's quite the accomplishment).  The owner practically lives there because he's OCD, paranoid and just plain fucking crazy and is afraid of being ripped off by someone.  Everyone is out to get money from him, or at least he thinks so.  He has one other person running the restaurant with him, but she's 20 years old and pretty much does all the work.  I feel bad for her sometimes becasue she practically lives there too (I'm not exaggerating either, they shower and sleep in this place).

Unfortunately, I am the best server there.  I don't do anything special, I can just handle having more than three tables at once and I actually do WORK.  Nobody does their job and I'm constantly picking up everyone's slack.  I usually work lunches, and when I open in the morning, the bar and dining area is always a mess.  Always, always.

Um.. hi.  Remember the restaurant you work at?  Yea, you need to keep it clean.  I've written a note... A NOTE!  I never write notes!  I came in the other morning and it looked like they had had a party after closing.  Writing a note was the bitchiest thing I could do at the time considering the servers who closed the previous night were not readily available for me to yell at.

I've never worked in a place like this before.  I'm vying for a job at a new restaurant opening up on Main St (cha-ching!  Main St is where it's at in Dubuque) that will undoubtedly be busier and nicer.

I need to make a shit ton of money in the next few weeks so I have spending money for Vegas.  I'm going the 23-27 with my mom, her friend and her daughter who is my age.  This is a much needed vacation on my part, although I've been on permanent vacation from school since graduating NICC in December - the day after my 21st birthday.

And that pretty much sums up my life in recent months.  I'd bore you all to tears with an update on my life since I last posted.

I have been on a Bob Dylan kick the last few days.  I bought a book by Spin magazine that recaps the last 20 years of alternative music and I now have a list of artists/bands that I need to listen to.

The Oscars are extremely self-glorifying.

But I can't stop watching since their is probably nothing else to watch.

I logged back into my Livejournal after almost a year of not touching it.

Wooo.

So.. how are things?
This is Leroy. I found him on a shelf in Goodwill today. He sits on my dashboard But doesn't hold on very well I think he'll tag along in my adventures from now on.

I don't think I've had more fun at a get together than last night.

Taylor and I were a little late to arrive.  Yes, I'm the kind of person who likes to get to parties early.  Fashionably late is no longer fashionable, people!

We were greeted by an already drunken Fincel showing off the puddle of puke in Ann's driveway.  I'm not one to stare at vomit, so I quickly made my way inside.

Opening Ann's kitchen door, I was greeted by a heartwarming, "HEEEEEYYY!!" by a group of friends playing Asshole.  That is such a wonderful sound to hear when you arrive.  I wish that would happen whenever I arrived anywhere - work, school, mall, funeral, anyplace!  It instantly uplifts your spirits and makes you feel welcomed.

Courtney and I announced our marital engagement and we danced, danced, danced to The Pixies, Ace of Base, French Kicks, and Action Action.  Nothing gets a party started like a mini dance party in the kitchen!  Shawna, Ann, Sara, and others all joined in at different times.

Umm... blur blur blur blur blur....

Those are all of the highlights that I can either remember or I feel are important enough to talk about.  But fear not for I had one hell of a time!

"You stupid Americans, always talking.  You're always saying 'Let me tell you something' or 'Can I just say something?'  Well you're dead now, so you can't!"

Pretty sure I botched that quote, but that movie is hilarious: Monty Python's Meaning of Life.  I love when the Grim Reaper comes in and tells the whole dinner party that they're dead and insults them.

Desi's soiree last night was ten tons of fun.  Rafters is such a cute restaurant, and very romantic.  Unfortunately, Desi and I couldn't have much alone time.. hahaha.  I suppose it could be romantic if you were with a significant other.  It's a little on the pricey side, but nothing too outrageous.  My pasta was $12.99, and then the waitress added an 8% gratuity to each check because we were a larger group.

Then we went back to Desi's coworker's apartment.  The snow was really coming down which made driving somewhat difficult.  I made a wrong turn onto a street that wasn't yet plowed and almost got stuck trying to get into someone's driveway.  I love how the snow held off until yesterday afternoon and was literally dumped all over town.

Played the usual drinking games, got a little crazy, played some Catchphrase which is kind of hard when you're intoxicated.

Now I get to do it all over again tonight at Ann's.  Fuck right!

I don't think I've attended church since my cousin Morgan's communion many years ago. My grandma used to take my brother and I to a church that has since been demolished and replaced with an off-ramp. My brother stopped going at a fairly young age claiming that he didn't believe in Jesus. I soon followed suit and said the same thing. Since then, I have only attend church a few sporadic times with friends or family. For awhile, I claimed to be an atheist because of all the bad rap that certain religions were earning themselves. It seemed like God was saying some pretty terrible things about some of His "children" and I didn't see how I could believe in him then. I know it wasn't Him who was saying them but some loud mouth fanatic who claimed so. I realized that claiming to be an atheist was far too harsh. It was almost like I was saying that I hate God, and I don't. Then I called myself Agnostic and kept up some sort of belief in Him. The idea of organized religion kind of scares me. They all have rules that I either don't want to follow or know that I personally could not. I see no problem in simply having a belief in God and trying to be a good person. Who's to say one religion is better over another? I doubt that I could pick a certain religion out of the thousands of them that are currently practicing. Or worse, I could end up in a cult. The idea of wearing white robes and picking lima beans for The Leader does not appeal to me. I have Kanye West's "College Dropout" currently in my car's CD player. Eventually the track "Jesus Walks" came on. Whenever I hear it, I really think about the words.
"Jesus Walks" by Kanye West Yo, We at war We at war with terrorism, racism, and most of all we at war with ourselves (Jesus Walks) God show me the way because the Devil trying to break me down (Jesus Walks with me) with me with me with me [fades] You know what the Midwest is? Young & Restless Where restless Niggaz might snatch your necklace And next these Niggaz might jack your Lexus Somebody tell these Niggaz who Kanye West is I walk through the valley of the shadow of death Top floor the view alone will leave you breathless Uhhhh! Try to catch it Uhhhh! It's kinda hard hard Getting choked by the detectives yeah yeah now check the method They be asking us questions, harass and arrest us Saying "we eat pieces of shit like you for breakfast" Huh? Yall eat pieces of shit? What's the basis? We ain't going nowhere but got suits and cases A trunk full of coke rental car from Avis My momma used to say only Jesus can save us Well momma I know I act a fool But I'll be gone til November I got packs to move I Hope [Hook x2] (Jesus Walks) God show me the way because the Devil trying to break me down (Jesus Walks with me) The only thing that that I pray is that my feet don't fail me now (Jesus Walks) And I don't think there is nothing I can do now to right my wrongs (Jesus Walks with me) I want to talk to God but I'm afraid because we ain't spoke in so long To the hustlas, killers, murderers, drug dealers even the strippers (jesus walks with them) To the victims of Welfare for we living in hell here hell yeah (jesus walks with them) Now hear ye hear ye want to see Thee more clearly I know he hear me when my feet get weary Cuz we're the almost nearly extinct We rappers are role models we rap we don't think I ain't here to argue about his facial features Or here to convert atheists into believers I'm just trying to say the way school need teachers The way Kathie Lee needed Regis that's the way yall need Jesus So here go my single dog radio needs this They say you can rap about anything except for Jesus That means guns, sex, lies, video tapes But if I talk about God my record won't get played Huh? Well let this take away from my spins Which will probably take away from my ends Then I hope this take away from my sins And bring the day that I'm dreaming about Next time I'm in the club everybody screaming out (Jesus Walks) God show me the way because the devil trying to break me down (Jesus Walks) The only thing that that I pray is that my feet don't fail me now
It really makes you think...

I have two alarms stored on my phone. One is for 6:30 for Mondays/Wendesdays when I have News Writing at 8am. The other is for 8 when for Tuesdays and Thursdays when I have Mass Media at 10. I set the wrong alarm this morning. Can you guess which one? Yell it out if you know the answer! Since I wasn't in class to fax it over, I e-mailed the rough draft of my article to my News Writing teacher. We had to write about something for the NICC newspaper. I decided that the new GSA would be a good topic, and the article only had to be one page, double spaced. It was probably the crappiest piece of crap I ever wrote for an assignment. You'd think that a one-page article would be super easy but it's actually hard because you have less space to say what you want to say. Therefore, I blanked because I'm not exactly sure what NICC's GSA wants to accomplish. I guess going to the meetings would help, but I'm going to the one at 3 and hopefully Mattie will be there. Well sit right down my wicked son God, I fucking love The Pixies. And I love that Windows Media Player is playing all of The Pixies song on this playlist one right after another. Today I was able to present my poster about me for Human Relations. My partner I paired up with on Monday didn't come to class so I had to talk about myself. We were suppose to pair up, learn about that person and their poster, and then present our partner. I was kind of happy because I figured she would screw some things up. My teacher made fun of me because I put "Tomatoes" under my list of Dislikes. When I listed my favorite bands/artists (The Pixies, Louis XIV, The Faint, Rufus Wainwright, and U2) she said, "Well, I've heard of U2, that's about it." Good times were had by all. This emo boy had a picture of Mars Volta on his poster, which was cool.

Alex and I sort of discussed moving in together when he gets back home for the summer. Actually, we were walking around Kohl's and ended up at the home interior section staring at a display of square plates. I really like square plates because they're unconventional. Alex said, "We should buy these for our first house!" The square plates were neat colors, but nothing too flashy. You don't really want flashy plates because they distract from the food (Learned that from Queer Eye). Alex and I agreed that it boiled down to the age old question: Style or Substance? Style We didn't get into a very serious discussion about it. We really just wandered around picking out dinnerware and pillows that we liked. I wouldn't mind moving in with him because we're close friends and we'd have a good time. The boy is going to be an interior decorator so you know our apartment won't be ugly. I told him that if I were to move out, I didn't really want to stay in Dubuque. He may have a chance at a job in Des Moines being a visual director for one of their high school's color guards. Apparently it pays very well, and Des Moines wouldn't be so bad. I guess I tend to think of Des Moines being really ghetto and dirty when it really isn't. We could always go see Senior's guard at Vets each December. :) I've never been a spectator there before so it'd be a definite change. Ever since Kelly wanted to move out after our senior year, I've wanted to have a nice apartment where I could buy cute, unconventional decorations for it. I love looking at the home interior sections at Target, Kohl's, and Pier 1. I smell like Burberry Brit and Ralph Lauren's Romance. I accidently sprayed men's cologne on my hand at Younker's. At least it smells nice and the Brit is overpowering the Romance.

I know I've said this before, but I really need to quit drinking. I tend to have some really fucked up dreams afterwards. Last night's was no exception. I was at an airport with a friend from elementary school. We had some time before our plane departed so we were spending it at a used bookstore inside the airport. The shelves were somewhat bare, but the books there were gold. We found a bunch of books from series we used to read in elementary/junior high school. Or at least, that's what I thought in the dream. In reality, I've never even heard of these books, whatever they were called. Suddenly, I stumbled upon a diamond in the rough. The book looked like it was written at a third grade level and probably didn't exceed 15 pages. On the cover was a large group of African-American pirates whooping it up aboard a pirate ship. One pirate stood out in familiarity. I read the title of the book which helped me recognize that certain pirate. The title was Bobby Brown's Adventure or something close. I realized that it was a series of books following Mr. Bobby Brown (yes, THE Bobby Brown) on an assortment of crazy adventures. This particular book involved Bobby and his band of black pirates. Sadly, I didn't get to read the book. I was looking forward to seeing a bunch of pirates dance and snort cocaine. Cocaaaaaiiinnee!! Speaking of which, I'm watching Blow which is a fucking great movie. Everyone should see this and become a cocaine dealer with me.

I registered with Sedona Staffing today.  They're the place that finds jobs for me.

I had to take a proficiency test with typing, Word and Excel.  I got 100% on Word and the lady told I was the first person in awhile to do that, and I also did very well in Excel.  She told me that it shouldn't be too hard to find me a clerical job somewhere.

Taylor got fired for Sunnycrest yesterday for some crazy shit.  He wasn't too depressed about it since he knew he could find a better job somewhere else.  Today he found at a job as a Poker dealer at the casino.  Fucking $17.00 an hour with benefits.

On the downside, he told me that he had to cut his hair.  =( What is with me and guys having to cut their hair?  Brian P had gorgeous long black hair but he decided it would be beneficial to his career to cut it short.  It breaks my heart, really, that employers are so conservative about male hair length that if anyone wants a chance at a decent job, they have to hawe a 50's style crew cut.

Oh well.  My eyes are dry.

I had to drive practically all over Dubuque today.  I came back in town from school and went to my Grandma's apartment to follow her to the car dealership so that she could return her rental car.  For some reason (probably because she's old) she had to drive on the small streets through neighborhoods instead of the main FASTER streets.  Then she made me take a right turn out of the dealership because the highway is too tricky to take a left on. 

I had to drive past the fairgrounds and through Asbury to get back to the Arterial so that I could drive down to John Deere Rd where her new car was.  For out of town readers, that's a hell of a lot of excess driving.  After she got her car, I had to follow her back to her apartment.  I feel like I spent about 45 minutes to an hour just driving which is more than I really like to do.

After leaving, I went to the Riverwalk and sat there for awhile because it was such a nice day.  I meant to do some deep pondering about life but I ended up being distracted by the cute ducks walking on the remaining pieces of ice.  So cute.  I love ducks!!  I also threw a couple of heavy rocks onto the ice chunks in attempt to break them but it didn't work.  After about twenty minutes, I couldn't stand how cold it was by the river and in the partial shade.

I have this pain on the right side of my back that comes when I'm sitting at the computer.  It's probably a result of sitting too long on an uncomfortable chair.  This is probably a sign that I should exercise more.

So I'm thinking that my Psychology of Human Relations class is going to be about group therapy and emotions and shit. We'll be subjected to circle discussions, feelings, and learn about self-love. This means I'll have to emote in front of people. I'll have to show more emotion than just cynicism and sarcasm. Yuck, stupid touchy-feely stuff. That's the message I got from the teacher. Just the way she was talking about different situations we have to deal with (loss, stress, love, etc) sounds like some therapy middle-aged women attend to get in touch with the feelings they've repressed for so long. But I get to make a collage about myself for Monday's class! I can also find a song that represents me or I have special feelings for. How about this one playing on Sirius right now: And I can't make it on my own Because my heart is in Ohio Cut my wrists and black my eyes So I can fall asleep tonight And die Because you kill me You know you do You kill me well... That'd be hilarious, especially since there is an emo kid in my class.

I wasn't tired until just now. I was at Jonni's house with Taylor and Charles until 1 a.m. watching The Sopranos. It's like we're all determined to watch the entire series before the new season starts in March. First day of school today! Hooray, finally something to pass the time. Anyway, my Intro to Mass Media class sounds like it should be fun. It's all about media and how it effects our daily lives. We also get to go on field trips to radio stations and stuff! Environmental Science should be interesting only because I suspect that the teacher experimented with Acid during college. He's way too excited about everything, even bacteria. This class also offers field trips to students who are taking the lab (I'm one of them). I guess we go somewhere almost every week like nature preserves and places nearby. I hope my News Writing class takes field trip too. The less time I have to spend at that place the better.
Take this quiz at QuizGalaxy.com

I went and got my books for this semester today, and I also pinned up the fliers I made about my books for sale around school. $280-some for three books, and they were out of the News Writing & Reporting book. Oh well, it's not my money! I've recently discovered two bands: We Are Scientists and She Wants Revenge. I seem to be starting a trend with bands that have three or more words in their names (Those two, Sorry About Dresden, The Stock Market Crash, etc). Anyway, I'm loving this song by SWR. It's called "I Don't Wanna Fall in Love"
I would like to tell you, I would like to say That I knew that this would happen That things would go this way But I cannot deceive you, this was never planned I know that you're the right girl but do you think that I am the right man? 1...2...3...4,5,6,7, Right face wrong time, she's sweet (But I don't wanna fall in love) Too late, so deep, better run cause (but I don't wanna fall in love) Can't sleep, can't eat, can't think straight ( I don't wanna) You say it's not a problem, You say it's meant to be But love is not an option, our love is never free And things are not so easy, so cold and we've been burned I know that I'll have regrets but that's the price of one more lesson learned 1..2..3...4,5,6,7, Right face wrong time, she's sweet (But I don't wanna fall in love) Too late, so deep, better run cause (but I don't wanna fall in love) Can't sleep, can't eat, can't think straight ( I don't wanna) Right face wrong time, she's sweet (But I don't wanna fall in love) Too late, so deep, better run cause ( I don't wanna fall in love) Right face wrong time, she's sweet (But I don't wanna fall in love) Can't sleep, can't eat, can't think straight ( I don't wanna fall in love) Right face wrong time, she's sweet (But I don't wanna fall in love) Too late, so deep, better run cause ( I don't wanna fall in love) Right face wrong time, she's sweet (But I don't wanna fall in love) Can't sleep, can't eat, can't think straight ( I don't wanna, I don't wanna, I don't wanna)
"Sister" is also a very very good song.

This whole not having a job thing seemed like a great idea at the time.  Finals were approaching and that left me time to properly prepare for all of them.  I was able to spend a little more time at The Center and be involved like I wanted to be.

So now it's been a month and a half and I wish I had a job more than anything else.  My savings are dipping dangerously low, like they did in May when I only worked two days a week at Benjamin's.

Originally, I was for sure that $800 would sustain me for what I thought was only going to be a couple weeks.  Now I'm at about $280 and really wishing for Dad to call me with the money he owes for Birthday and Christmas.

I've scoured the classifieds so many times.  The only jobs either involved a degree/experience of some kind, heavy lifting, or something that I could never do (auto technician?).  I applied at the Olive Garden when I swore I would never work in a restaurant again.

I doubt that the TH is going to call me back.  I figured someone more experienced than me applied.  It's ri-fucking-diculous.  All this free time has left me feeling like I'm a useless person with no worth to society.  I need a job to occupy my time, especially with school starting since I'll need money for coffee, lunch, and gas (yes, coffee is very important when you have an 8 a.m. class).

Fuck, I just wish something good would happen soon.

I wanted to get my sleeping schedule back in somewhat of a normal fashion.  Last night I left Mark's a little after 1, quite pissed that Finny wouldn't let me play GTA: San Andreas.

I got home and went online for a bit before I headed off to bed.  I probably fell asleep close to 2 a.m. and then I woke up at 2:11.  This doesn't really help me in trying to go to bed early!  Dammit.

Ann, Finny, Alexx and I went to Carlos O'Kelly's for dinner.  Ann and I discussed the name of the person who invented the restaurant and how Carlos is a Spanish name but O'Kelly sounds Irish.  I figured that his father was an Irish immigrant who moved into the area that is now known as Texas (this happened over a hundred years ago I'm assuming).  He then fell in love with a Mexican migrant worker, married her and had a son who started a Mexican style restaurant with immediate seating available and happy hour!

So last night was pretty freaking awesome. I was a dirty little whore, and so were some of my friends. I have a new favorite drink and I wish to make it all the time. Wheeeeeeee!!!! And this morning I watched Anchorman: The Legend of Ron Burgundy which was a very great way to relax after last night. I'm also very very hungry, and have been since 4 a.m.

So NICC's website is wack. I guess I'll never know what the hell my grades are because either my teachers haven't put them up or I'm doing something wrong.

I've seen this ad on Myspace for this eczema medicine.  It starts out saying, "Do you have skin?"

No, I don't and it's a very sensitive subject for me.

35 Million people with skin have eczema.

I'm one of them, motherfucker!

I'm getting more than my reccomended dosage of The Sopranos. We watched the first four episodes last night at Jonni's. Though I guess I watched them because Jonni and Charles were playing Nintendo DS and Taylor was asleep.

I bought two new notebooks for this semester and Carebear pencils. =D I love being a child at heart.

Maybe I'm subconsciously bisexual.  I'm not sure what time I had this dream, it was either when I was asleep on Jonni's floor or in my nice bed.  I made out with a chick but I really couldn't see her so I tried to pretend it was a guy.  That segment only lasted for a couple minutes before I moved on to the next thing.

Dreams are so straaaaange!!

Beep-beep-beep... beep-beep-beep The infernal noise that awakens me from a peaceful slumber. I reach out and flip open my phone to check the time. Only this morning that noise was actually a reminder of a friend's birthday. I curse myself for setting the reminder so early in the day - I assumed that I would have been awake. Struggling with the choice of staying in bed or arising to face the cold, cold room, I snuggle further under the blankets to rest my eyes. I debate whether to hit "Play" on my CD player to listen to RENT once more as I have a song stuck in my head. In bed, I ponder over last night's antics. Spontaneous trip to Perkin's because of the cop cars in the parking lot, trying to get kicked out of Wal-mart, and back to Charles' house. I lay in that resting state for another thirty minutes before I think, I should really get up. Unfortunately, my many blankets entice my lazy side, urging me to bury further under them and sleep away the day. I make a promise to myself to not fall back asleep... ... My phone suddenly reads "1:30". Shit. I decide that now is a good time to get up. I was for sure that I would not sleep so late since I had called it an early night. 3:30 may be late to some, but considering I have been staying up until 5 almost every night, 3:30 seems much earlier. I like sleep too much.

I spend about an hour and a half at Wal-mart yesterday which is more time than I want to spend there. At least I got Subway. Matt came home from Florida and had to get 8 disposable cameras developed. He then decided that completely rotating The Center around would be a great idea. By which I mean that he wanted to switch the stage and the concession area around. It was too much work for five people to do, but we got most of it done! Later that night I learned that I really do have the power to tell men what to do. As a result, I saw more of Charles than I ever needed to. The Sopranos is a good, good show. I think today I shall do more job hunting. The fucking Telegraph Herald better call me soon or else I'll be disappointed.

Last night: - I drank what I believe to be expired Michelob Pumpkin Spice beer - I was punched in the ovaries twice. Now I shall never bear children - Some genius blew the fuse and so we had a random word fight by candlelight - staight up Abe Lincoln style - Ann and I declared that since Bacardi Island Breeze tastes like cold medicine, it is okay for you if you have a cold - I decided that when Hans Hellmutt hits it big, I will sell the drawing of Ben Eagle's eye and mouth on Ebay or something. Today: - I saw Fun with Dick and Jane with Alex. It's a very funny movie, and Richard Jenkins (Nathanial Fisher Sr on Six Feet Under) is absolutely hilarious. - I blogged about my feelings I think my new year's resolution will be to A) Open up more and B) Eat less junk food.

I have a cold, but it's not as bad as the last two I had.  Hopefully it won't be like last time when I got a cold, got over it, and then got another one.

I also have a canker sore or something on the inside of my lip.  I applied some salt to it which reduced some of the swelling.  If only I could stop biting/sucking on it.

List of people/things I want to punch in the face:

- Carson Daly, who I had to spend New Year's Eve with

- Hilary Duff, see above

- Dane Thumser for being an idiot and throwing a cherry into my water, twice!

- The CD player at The Center for taking so long to read a CD

- Wal-mart

- "Scene" kids who live in Dubuque

- Panera for being closed last night when we wanted to eat there

- Dane Thumser for staying stupid things about drag shows


And I think that's it.  I don't really enjoy thinking of violent things to do to people.  But now I think I'll go <strike>attempt suicide</strike> pay a visit to Wal-mart to use up the last of my gift card.

In the year 2006 I resolve to:
Not lose any pencils.

Get your resolution here

Damn, that's actually a good resolution.

-I'm going to have somebody to kiss tonight.




Too bad I have a cold now.

Lunchmeat is a terrible horror movie from the 80s. Not only is the acting terrible and the plot weak, but there's fucking cannabalism and decapitation in it. I was grossed out but I was laughing at it's lameness the entire time. I ate lukewarm broccoli and cheddar soup at Perkin's last night. It was delicious after the waitress warmed it up. We had to listen to a bunch of 16-year-old scenesters talk really loud about their stupid shannenagins, and then one (who I was in Theatre class with) came over and asked me to take a picture of all of them. I love how she seemed to have completely forgotten me. "Hey, you were in my speech class freshman year.. no, theatre!" Then Taylor, Jake and I hung out at Kwik Stop waiting for Charles. They drank Von Dutch Energy Drink (FTW??) while I had some Rockstar. Unfortunately, Jake had found Lunchmeat in Taylor's backseat (maye I shouldn't have claimed "shotgun" that time). We somehow ended up back at my house to watch it, and Charles later joined us. They found my mom's Truth Jenga game - it's played like normal Jenga only there are questions on each block. You draw a block, read the question and give it to whomever you want to answer it. Fun game. Anyway, don't watch Lunchmeat. It's full of psychotic rednecks and preppy teenagers, though I guess most horror movies have those. Isn't it funny how horror movies are so popular but the actors in those movies rarely do any work after that? It's like if you do a horror movie, you instantly lose all chance of ever working in Hollywood again - unless you're Naomi Watts, of course.

I grow tiresome of my music.  While I have a nice collection, I get bored with things easily.  Alas, I have not the funds to purchase new CDs; therefore, I shall have friends burn me CDs.

Music is love.

I applied for a job at the Telegraph Herald yesterday as a News Room Clerk or something.  I forget the exact title but it involves proofreading spelling and grammar.  I really hope I get that job because I know I would love it.  I'm sure it doesn't pay more than maybe $8 but I won't care.

Money is love.


I think today to appease my boredom, I shall spend my American Eagle giftcard.  I wanted to the day after Christmas but the store was so busy and the line was very long.  They were the same the next day when Alex and I stopped out there.

Speaking of Alex:  He's currently in Rosemont, IL auditioning for the Rosemont Cavaliars Drum Corp.  They're honestly one of the best in the world, and I hope he gets a spot on the color guard.  One of the coaches wanted him as an alternate for the summer in case someone gets kicked out/injured.

Drum corps are love.

When I finish reading this book: I will be an expert on all areas including, but not limited to: - Snowball fights - Dog People vs Cat People - Hoboes, and the hobo life style - Movies in which John Hodgman appeared - Omens It's a good book and I highly reccomend it. Also - I got a haircut today. It's not too different aside from my bangs being shorter, my layers defined and razored ends.

I'm insanely bored. It feels wierd to have nothing to blog about today. I tried to spend my American Eagle card, but the store was ridiculously busy. I wanted this pink long sleeve shirt, but I guess it can wait for another day. So instead I spent some of my Wal-mart card and some of my Panera card. =) I love getting a bunch of stuff without using any real money. I think I'll use real money tomorrow if I can get in a haircut - I really really need one. My hair is going wild, although anyone other than me probably doesn't notice it. Christmas night is extremely boring since EVERYTHING aside from a gas station is closed. Taylor and I drove around for awhile looking for someplace to go or someone to hang out with. Everyone either had to work in the morning or were still occupied by family stuff. Stupid families. We eventually went to his friend Sam's house (the place I went to with all the emo kids who gawked at me). One on one, Sam is a pretty cool guy. Like I said, nothing was opened but we assumed that Wal-mart would have been. We drove all the way out there, walked to the front doors only to find that they didn't open automatically for us. They tricked us because the sign was on and so were a bunch of lights. We went back to Sam's and watched the movie Blow. It's pretty good, although I dozed off for a bit during it. I was also distracted when two Chris's came by, completely wasted. I really hate obnoxious drunks, I really do. And usually the people who are obnoxious while inebriated are obnoxious during sobriety. I guess some people can't handle their liquor.

So, Christmas present recap: - $20 giftcard to American Eagle - $15 to Panera! - $25 giftcard to Wal-mart.. meh - The faux-fur lined vest that I wanted from Old Navy - A matching Isotoner scarf, hat, and gloves set, but I can't wear it since they're Isotoner and they're expensive. - Garden State on DVD - The Areas of My Expertise by John Hodgman - $20 - A car phone charger - A Kodak EasyShare Digital Camera!! Technically, it's for the family but I know I'll be using it the most. - A set of ruby earrings and a set of diamond earrings. They're little studs, and they cost about $20 each (mom left the price tag on them!) - One of those weird squishy pillows I think that's it. I'm pretty happy with all that I got, mainly because I didn't ask for too much.

I just got home from Christmas Eve with my dad's family.

1.  My cousin Cathy drank a whole bottle of wine PLUS two glasses of Baily's Irish Creme.  It's hard to think of her as my cousin because she's 38 and her oldest daughter is two years younger than me.

2.  Speaking of which, her daughter Mallorie is now engaged to her boyfriend of two years.  She's 18 years old.

3.  My drunk aunts talked about sex... eew...

4.  I finally built up the courage to try the traditional oyster stew.  Not just the broth this time, but the actual contents of the stew.  It took me 20 years, and it really isn't so bad.  I wouldn't eat it anywhere other than Christmas Eve.

5.  But I did get a glass of Bailey's, another tradition.  Mmm-mmm.

6.  Dad says I can't drink next year even though I'll be 21.  I have to be the fucking DD.

I was lying in bed trying to go back to sleep when I received a phone call from a police officer.  Some guy ran a stopsign and hit my grandma, completely totalling her car.

Fortunately, she was all right.  But her car is pretty much gone, and the asshole who hit her flipped his car.

It's a great way to start my Christmas Eve.

Yesterday, Alex offered to take me to California with him next year.  He recently got accepted into the Art Institute of California-San Diego.  I love San Diego, I visted there a couple years ago, and would love to live there.

At first I just laughed it off and failed to give him a definite answer.  But this morning I was seriously considering it.  It would definitely be a change of pace to Dubuque, and a major change of scenery.

<u>Pros:</u>
- I would leave Dubuque.  As far back as I can remember, none of my future plans involved me staying in Dubuque.  When I wanted to raise horses, I'd move to Kentucky, and when I wanted to be involved with music - somewhere east.
- It's a hell of a lot warmer in CA than it is in Iowa
- I'd be more motivated to persue my dreams of journalism because it would be a large does of reality
- The beaches - the mother fucking beaches!
- My mom has two friends that live there.  I met one of them when I went to San Diego, but my mom has known these two women since high school
- Like I mentioned, it would be a large kick in the ass to get up and do something about my life

<u>Cons:</u>
- It's expensive to live in California
- It's very far away
- What if I end up not doing anything other than just live there and work at the mall or something?
- Alex and I would really only have each other to fall back on
- I'd obviously miss my friends and family.  I probably wouldn't be able to see them more than once a year.

I don't really want to get my hopes up about this.  Although I'm optimistic, I still have a nagging feeling that this is just going wind up as another pipe dream.

Alex said that if I live there for a year, I can go to a state school for free/really cheap (I have to look into that because I don't think he interpreted that correctly).  I figured that I could either
A. Find a community college to finish my Gen Eds
B. Work full time for a year and earn lots of money.  During which, I could maybe do some freelance journalism for experience

I need more time to think about this.

I got Lua all pimped out last night!  Yaaay!  My CD player is so fucking awesome (for only being $95 - I checked it out at Best Buy) and looks awesome in my car.  The only problem is that the CD player has blue lights while the other lights on my dash are green.

Other than that, it sounds great.  I decided on taking The Faint's "Danse Macabre" to be the first CD to play in because of the bass in the songs.

I met Taylor at BB and we cruised around a bit with nothing to do.  We ended up at Charles' house but nobody answered the door.  We decided on going to Country Kitchen and getting a bite to eat.

We then switched cars because I was sick of driving and went to the river.  It's a little cold to be walking down there at 12:30 at night.

Finally ended up back at Charle's and had somebody let us in (he lives in a boarding house) and we broke into his room where he was curled up on the floor.  

My friend's band, Hans Helmutt, is reuniting tonight for a show at the Busted Lift.  I've never seen them perform so I'm super excited.
Umm.... buy me one of these: Size 8, and I will love you forever and ever and a day. I don't have a job, so I can't afford to go willy-nilly on a $40 pair of shoes. Pweeeeeease?

So my birthday ended pretty well.

My cousin AJ brought me a cake made by my aunt Marcia.  Get this, she made cake batter and then melted Milky Ways into the batter.  To top it off, she whipped up her own frosting of butter, chocolate frosting, and marshmallow fluff.

Oh yea, you can't eat a whole piece - well, I couldn't.  Especially after eating dinner.

Then I got to spend the evening with my favorite girls.  Dairy Queen seemed like a good idea until we remembered how cold ice cream is in mid-December.

I had a crazy dream last night that I thought was real.  I dreamt that Ann gave me something that I put in my coat pocket.  When I got home, I put my coat away in the wardrobe although I knew I should have taken that object out.  I woke up at 3am thinking I should get that out of my coat!  But then I realized it was a dream.

I can't wait for Thursday at 8pm to get my CD player installed into Lua.  =D  She'll be so happy, as will I!

So far it's been a good day - maybe because I've been in a really good mood.  I mean, it's my birthday, it sucks to be unhappy.

Last year I had serious cramps, to the point where I couldn't eat anything (delicious Chinese) because of the pain.  But I did test drive a new car.

Anyway, so far today I took a Soc test, bought a pair of mittens to match my scarf, and then met my dad at Pizza Ranch for lunch.  Although it's my birthday, I still owed him a lunch from when he took me to school one day.

Okay, so $14.96 was somewhat of a rip-off because the pizza there isn't that good.  You'd think a place called "Pizza Ranch" would have the pizza as their best dish.  I liked the caesar salad better!  The guy gave my dad a senior discount and I told him that was fine since I was paying.

My Uncle Jim, cousin AJ and Grandma are coming by in the next couple hours for dinner.  My mom is making my favorite meal of hers - it's really hard to describe but it's wonderful.  Hopefully then I can finally open some friggin presents!!  So far, all I've gotten was $20 from my brother and Happy Birthday comments - thanks guys!

So here we are. In a little over 6 hours I will be the BIG Two-Zero! Midnight counts as my birthday, unless you're one of those fuckheads who consider your time of birth as the beginning of your birthday. Okay, so then how many hours away is 9:54 am? My mom took me to Factory Card Outlet today so that she could find little gifts to include in her presents for her friends. I wandered around the aisles until I came upon the aisle with the Over the Hill favors. I saw one for 30 years old and thought "That's going to be me in ten years." While the Over the Hill stuff probably isn't too funny when you're young, they're a surreal realization of what's ahead. Getting old doesn't appeal to me. I hate old people driving, and I hated waiting on old people because they can't hear. I love my grandma, but it's often hard to have a conversation with her - especially on Thanksgiving when her hearing aid wasn't working. Hearing aids? Walkers? Menopause? What is there to look forward to over yonder hill? Gravity will take its effect, unless I hit it rich and can afford regular plastic surgeries. Maybe I'll end up a sharp old lady who drinks gin martinis (haha) and lies about poolside all day. Or maybe I'll deterioate and end up in a home wearing a diaper and watching reruns of All in the Family. Perhaps I'll be the crazy old cat lady who bitches about how dirty television has become and how kids have no respect... but I think I'm pretty close to that already. Darn teenagers, no respect. Sure, in the next years I'll graduate college, start a career, get married, maybe have a kid or two. I'll earn wisdom and respect, gain experiences and travel to many places. Right now, those dreams are only that, dreams. They're centuries away from where I am now. Will I live to see the apocalypse? Will we finally develop into what imaginative scientists/cartoonist predicted we would be at this time? Are we going to ride in hover cars, live in the sky, colonize on the moon? Maybe someone will develop robots to do our house chores. But in those cartoons and movies, everyone was in peak physical condition despite the fact that they had moving sidewalks and robots - we all know we're not anywhere near that condition presently. What more do I have to look forward to? More challenges, responsibilities, and hardships? Maybe I''ll end up a crack addict with three kids turning tricks in East Dubuque. Or maybe I'll become the editor of Vogue - yea, the latter sounds much more appeasing, with or without the cocaine habit... Take it from me kids, 20 isn't all that fantastic. I can feel my back going as we speak. It's only a matter of time before the hip replacement and Bridge nights with Gerty and Ethel. All I can do is live for the moment and plan ahead for my future. Like the headline of my Myspace blog says: Hope for the best, plan for the worst and maybe wind up somewhere in the middle. - "Loose Leaves" by Bright Eyes.

I just got finished taking the worst test of my life.  I fucking hate math.

First off:  I failed to realize that the test started at 10 instead of 11 which was the normal class time.  Since we never finished Chapter 8, he took off the last 3 questions, which was good.

I am math-retarded.  Basic stuff I can do just find, but anything else is mumbo-jumbo to me.

The room was 1,000 degrees (Farenheit), which caused me to shed several layers of clothes immediately.  First my coat came off, then my scarf, and then my sweatshirt.  It probably didn't help that I was drinking hot coffee, but oh well.

I will probably never ever pass a math class for as long as I live.  If I somehow get a 70 in that class, it'll be a fucking miracle.  I will drop to my knees, praise the Lord, and start going to church because I would be so elated and grateful.

I really want to cry.  I really really hate math.

I know what I'm getting mi padre for Christmas.

The John Belushi biography.  Pretty sure he likes Belushi, as do I.  I inherited a gene from him that tells me to like crazy comedy like Belushi, Billy Murray, Chevy Chase, etc.

I'm bored as hell.  Everyone is working or doing other things.

I got to see pictures from last weekend on Ann's photobucket site.  I forgot a few of them were taken, haha.

Instead of buying aforementioned book (I lacked the money), I bought myself a non-fat Mochaberry at Border's.  De-fucking-licious.  It helped lift my spirts that were weighed down by my worrying of several friends.

The Christmas drag show was wonderful.  I was happy to see someone who I haven't seen since last summer.  We were good friends in high school (junior year) and I'm always happy to see her when she's in town.

Mark's house was another story.
- I need alcohol to live, it's part of my lifeforce
- I am now the only one of my girl friends who is single, which kind of sucks.  Obviously, I'm happy for my friends but at the same time, I'm like "Ew, now I have to be a third wheel."  I should be used to it by now.
- Parties usually bring out the best in people, but last night it started some serious bullshit.
- I got some sweet ass Sharpie tattoos courtesy of Dan and Mark.  I had Mario on one shoulder and Jesus riding a dragon on the other.  Then Dan somehow convinced me to let him draw the Rebel Alliance logo on my face.  I stopped him before he drew all over my face. 

Curse Charles for messing up my sleeping schedule.  Pretty sure that Mike is getting me the RENT soundtrack for my birthday.  I feel bad that he got me a birthday and Christmas gift when I have no intention of getting him anything.
